what: Darwin Core Standard for Biodiversity Data
title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Darwin Core international standard biodiversity data enables interoperability different datasets systems. ZooGoN package implements Darwin Core compliance ensure LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data can integrated global biodiversity infrastructures.

previous_headings: Darwin Core Standard for Biodiversity Data
title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Darwin Core provides: Standardized terminology biodiversity data Interoperability different data systems FAIR principles compliance (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) International recognition biodiversity informatics community EMODnet Biology compatibility European marine data

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: ZooGoN package implements three main Darwin Core extensions:

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Event extension describes sampling events (, , samples collected): Example Event Record:
code: # Event extension structure for LTER-MareChiara data event_columns <- c(   "eventID",           # Unique identifier (e.g., "mc_1", "mc_2")     "eventDate",         # Date of sampling (ISO 8601 format)   "decimalLatitude",   # 40.81 (LTER-MareChiara coordinates)   "decimalLongitude",  # 14.25 (LTER-MareChiara coordinates)   "locality",          # "LTER-MareChiara station"   "country",           # "Italy"   "stateProvince",     # "Campania"   "waterBody",         # "Mediterranean Sea"   "samplingProtocol"   # Detailed sampling methodology ) example_event <- tibble::tibble(   eventID = "mc_318",   eventDate = "2015-03-15",   decimalLatitude = 40.81,   decimalLongitude = 14.25,   locality = "LTER-MareChiara station",   country = "Italy",    stateProvince = "Campania",   waterBody = "Mediterranean Sea",   samplingProtocol = "Vertical tow 0-50m, WP2 net (200μm mesh, 70cm diameter), ethanol fixation" )

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Occurrence extension describes species occurrences within sampling event: Example Occurrence Record:
code: # Occurrence extension structure occurrence_columns <- c(   "eventID",          # Links to Event table   "occurrenceID",     # Unique occurrence identifier   "scientificName",   # Original taxonomic name   "genus_species",    # Standardized taxonomic name (ZooGoN output)   "lifeStage",        # Development stage (adult, juvenile, copepodite)   "occurrenceStatus"  # "present" or "absent" ) example_occurrence <- tibble::tibble(   eventID = "mc_318",   occurrenceID = "mc_318-occ1",   scientificName = "Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893",   genus_species = "Chiridius poppei",  # Standardized by ZooGoN   lifeStage = "adult",   occurrenceStatus = "present" )

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: eMoF extension stores quantitative measurements additional facts: Example eMoF Record:
code: # eMoF extension structure emof_columns <- c(   "eventID",           # Links to Event table   "occurrenceID",      # Links to Occurrence table   "measurementType",   # Type of measurement   "measurementValue",  # Numeric value   "measurementUnit",   # Unit of measurement   "measurementMethod"  # How measurement was obtained ) example_emof <- tibble::tibble(   eventID = "mc_318",   occurrenceID = "mc_318-occ1",   measurementType = "abundance",    measurementValue = "15.2",   measurementUnit = "individuals per cubic meter",   measurementMethod = "Microscopic counting in Mini-Bogorov chamber" )

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: ZooGoN’s extract_genus_species() function enhances Darwin Core compliance :

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
code: # Examples of ZooGoN taxonomic standardization for Darwin Core taxonomic_cases <- tibble::tibble(   original_scientificName = c(     "Sardinella+Sardinops",                    # Species complex     "Clupeidae n.i.",                          # Family-level ID     "Engraulis - group",                       # Higher taxonomic group     "Lutjanus (Paradies) argentimaculatus (Forsskål, 1775)"  # With author   ),   standardized_scientificName = c(     "Sardinella spp",                          # Standardized complex     "Clupegenus sp",                           # Created genus name     "Engraulis indet",                         # Indeterminate group     "Lutjanus argentimaculatus"                # Clean binomial   ),   dwc_taxonomicStatus = c(     "species complex",     "family level identification",      "genus level identification",     "accepted"   ) )

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Darwin Core output designed validation World Register Marine Species (WoRMS):
code: # WoRMS integration workflow (conceptual) # This would be implemented in the data processing pipeline  validate_against_worms <- function(scientific_names) {   # 1. Submit names to WoRMS Taxon Match tool   # 2. Retrieve Life Sciences Identifiers (LSIDs)     # 3. Get accepted names and taxonomic hierarchy   # 4. Add scientificNameID field with WoRMS LSIDs      # Example result structure:   tibble::tibble(     scientificName = "Chiridius poppei",     scientificNameID = "urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:104689",     acceptedNameUsage = "Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893",     taxonomicStatus = "accepted",     kingdom = "Animalia",     phylum = "Arthropoda",      class = "Copepoda",     order = "Calanoida",     family = "Aetideidae",     genus = "Chiridius",     specificEpithet = "poppei"   ) }

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Measurements methodology terms standardized using British Oceanographic Data Centre (BODC) NERC Vocabulary Server:
code: # BODC vocabulary standardization examples bodc_terms <- tibble::tibble(   local_term = c(     "individuals per cubic meter",     "adult",     "WP2 net",     "ethanol fixation"   ),   bodc_preferred_term = c(     "Abundance of biota per unit volume of the water column",     "Adult development stage",     "WP2 net (mouth diameter 0.57m, mesh aperture 200um)",     "Ethanol preservation"   ),   bodc_uri = c(     "http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/SDBIOL01/",     "http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/S11/current/S1127/",      "http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0653/",     "http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/S04/current/S0404/"   ) )

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Darwin Core output meets EMODnet Biology quality control requirements:

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
code: # EMODnet Biology required fields check validate_emodnet_requirements <- function(darwin_core_data) {      required_event_fields <- c(     "eventID", "eventDate", "decimalLatitude", "decimalLongitude"   )      required_occurrence_fields <- c(     "eventID", "occurrenceID", "scientificName", "occurrenceStatus"   )      # Check for required fields   event_check <- all(required_event_fields %in% names(darwin_core_data$event))   occurrence_check <- all(required_occurrence_fields %in% names(darwin_core_data$occurrence))      # Validate data completeness   completeness_check <- darwin_core_data$event %>%     summarise(       missing_coords = sum(is.na(decimalLatitude) | is.na(decimalLongitude)),       missing_dates = sum(is.na(eventDate)),       total_events = n()     )      return(list(     event_fields_complete = event_check,     occurrence_fields_complete = occurrence_check,      completeness = completeness_check   )) }

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
code: # Validate geographic coordinates for Mediterranean Sea validate_coordinates <- function(lat, lon) {   # Mediterranean Sea approximate bounds   med_bounds <- list(     lat_min = 30.0, lat_max = 46.0,     lon_min = -6.0, lon_max = 36.0   )      valid_lat <- lat >= med_bounds$lat_min & lat <= med_bounds$lat_max   valid_lon <- lon >= med_bounds$lon_min & lon <= med_bounds$lon_max      return(valid_lat & valid_lon) }

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: complete Darwin Core workflow EMODnet Biology publication:
code: # Step 1: Process raw data with ZooGoN process_zoogon_data <- function(raw_data) {   raw_data %>%     # Apply taxonomic standardization     mutate(genus_species = extract_genus_species(taxa)$genus_species) %>%     # Convert to Darwin Core format     create_darwin_core_tables() }  # Step 2: Validate against standards validate_darwin_core <- function(dwc_data) {   # WoRMS validation   validated_taxonomy <- validate_against_worms(dwc_data$occurrence$scientificName)      # BODC vocabulary standardization     standardized_measurements <- standardize_bodc_terms(dwc_data$emof)      # EMODnet QC validation   qc_results <- validate_emodnet_requirements(dwc_data)      return(list(     taxonomy = validated_taxonomy,     measurements = standardized_measurements,     qc_status = qc_results   )) }  # Step 3: Generate Darwin Core Archive create_dwc_archive <- function(validated_data) {   # Package as Darwin Core Archive with:   # - meta.xml descriptor   # - eml.xml metadata   # - CSV data files   # - Rights and license information }

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Darwin Core-compliant LTER-MareChiara dataset contributes European Digital Twin Ocean providing: Standardized biodiversity data ecosystem modeling Long-term time series climate change assessment Quality-controlled observations model validation FAIR-compliant data streams automated ingestion integration supports EU Mission “Restore Ocean & Waters 2030” enhanced biodiversity monitoring evidence-based decision making.

title: Darwin Core Integration for Marine Biodiversity Data
text: Darwin Core standardization ensures 40 years LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data becomes valuable resource : Global biodiversity databases (GBIF, OBIS) European marine data infrastructure (EMODnet Biology) Digital Twin Ocean ecosystem models Climate change research conservation planning International scientific collaboration ZooGoN package facilitates transformation maintaining data quality scientific accuracy automated taxonomic standardization comprehensive quality control procedures.

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: vignette demonstrates complete data processing workflow LTER-MareChiara zooplankton dataset, covering 40 years monitoring (1984-2024) Gulf Naples. workflow transforms raw abundance data Darwin Core-compliant format integration EMODnet Biology European Digital Twin Ocean.

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: LTER-MareChiara station (40°81’N, 14°25’E) monitoring zooplankton communities since 1984 part Long-Term Ecological Research network. represents one longest continuous time series Mediterranean Sea. Key Dataset Characteristics: - Temporal Coverage: 1984-2024 (40 years) - Total Samples: 1,506 - Taxonomic Diversity: 148 copepod species + 61 taxa - Sampling Method: Vertical tows (0-50m depth) - Mesh Size: 200 μm - Location: Gulf Naples, Tyrrhenian Sea, Western Mediterranean

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: ZooGoN package provides complete, integrated function handles entire processing pipeline raw Excel files Darwin Core format: single function performs following steps automatically:
code: # Process LTER-MareChiara dataset with full workflow processed_data <- process_lter_data(   zoo_data_path = "data/lter_zoo_84_13.xlsx",   ids_data_path = "data/ids.xlsx",   worms_validation = TRUE,   output_format = "list",   verbose = TRUE )  # Access the Darwin Core formatted results event_table <- processed_data$event occurrence_table <- processed_data$occurrence   emof_table <- processed_data$emof processing_info <- processed_data$processing_info

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Comprehensive Workflow with process_lter_data()
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: Reads Excel files proper encoding name repair Validates file paths parameters Handles Excel date format conversion

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Comprehensive Workflow with process_lter_data()
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: Applies extract_genus_species() name standardization Splits genus-species names separate columns Creates taxa suitable WoRMS validation

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Comprehensive Workflow with process_lter_data()
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Enable WoRMS validation for taxonomic accuracy processed_with_worms <- process_lter_data(   worms_validation = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )  # WoRMS validation provides: # - Taxonomic authorities and publication dates   # - LSIDs (Life Sciences Identifiers) # - Accepted names and synonymy information # - Classification hierarchy verification

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Comprehensive Workflow with process_lter_data()
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: function automatically creates three core Darwin Core extensions: Event Extension: Sampling events temporal spatial metadata Occurrence Extension: Species occurrence records life stage information eMoF Extension: Quantitative measurements (abundance ind/m³)

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Comprehensive Workflow with process_lter_data()
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # LTER-MareChiara coordinates are automatically assigned: # - Latitude: 40.81°N # - Longitude: 14.25°E   # - Location: Gulf of Naples, Tyrrhenian Sea # - Sampling protocol: Vertical tow 0-50m depth

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Alternative Processing Options
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Skip WoRMS validation for faster execution quick_data <- process_lter_data(   worms_validation = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Alternative Processing Options
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Export directly to CSV files process_lter_data(   output_format = "csv",   output_dir = "processed_data/darwin_core",   verbose = TRUE )  # This creates: # - event.csv (sampling events) # - occurrence.csv (species occurrences)   # - emof.csv (measurements) # - raw_processed.csv (intermediate data) # - processing_metadata.csv (workflow metadata)

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: users prefer granular control, individual processing steps can performed manually:

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Manual Step-by-Step Processing
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Load zooplankton abundance data zooplankton_data <- readxl::read_xlsx(   "data/lter_zoo_84_13.xlsx",   .name_repair = "minimal" ) %>%   dplyr::mutate(dat_id = seq_len(dplyr::n()))  # Load sample identification data   sample_ids <- readxl::read_xlsx(   "data/ids.xlsx",   .name_repair = "minimal"   ) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     date = lubridate::as_date(as.numeric(date), origin = "1899-12-30"),     sample_id = janitor::make_clean_names(sample_id)   )

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Manual Step-by-Step Processing
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Extract and standardize taxonomic information raw_taxa <- zooplankton_data %>%   janitor::clean_names() %>%   dplyr::select(phylum_o_subphylum:stage, dat_id) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     genus_species = extract_genus_species(taxa)$genus_species   ) %>%   tidyr::separate(     genus_species,      into = c("genus", "species"),      sep = " ",      remove = FALSE,      fill = "right"   )

previous_headings: Data Processing Steps > Manual Step-by-Step Processing
title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Convert from wide to long format dates <- zooplankton_data %>%   dplyr::select(-c(1:10), dat_id)  tidy_data <- raw_taxa %>%   dplyr::left_join(dates, by = "dat_id") %>%   tidyr::pivot_longer(     -c(dat_id, taxa, genus_species, stage),     names_to = "date",     values_to = "ind_m3"   ) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     date = lubridate::as_date(as.numeric(date), origin = "1899-12-30")   ) %>%   dplyr::left_join(sample_ids, by = "date")

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code:
# Verify sample counts cat("Total samples processed:", n_distinct(darwin_core_data$eventID), "
") cat("Date range:", min(darwin_core_data$eventDate), "to", max(darwin_core_data$eventDate), "
") cat("Unique taxa:", n_distinct(darwin_core_data$scientificName), "
") cat("Total occurrences:", nrow(occurrence_extension), "
")  # Check for data completeness missing_coords <- event_extension %>%    filter(is.na(decimalLatitude) | is.na(decimalLongitude)) cat("Events missing coordinates:", nrow(missing_coords), "
")  # Verify taxonomic standardization success standardization_summary <- occurrence_extension %>%   summarise(     original_taxa = n_distinct(scientificName),     standardized_taxa = n_distinct(genus_species),     .groups = "drop"   ) print(standardization_summary)

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: Export processed data Darwin Core Archive format:
code: # Create output directory output_dir <- "processed_data/darwin_core" dir.create(output_dir, recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)  # Export Darwin Core tables readr::write_csv(event_extension,                   file.path(output_dir, "event.csv")) readr::write_csv(occurrence_extension,                   file.path(output_dir, "occurrence.csv"))   readr::write_csv(emof_extension,                   file.path(output_dir, "emof.csv"))  # Export metadata readr::write_csv(   tibble::tibble(     dataset_title = "40 years of Zooplankton data at LTER MareChiara site (Gulf of Naples, Mediterranean Sea) 1984-2024",     contact = "Dr. Iole Di Capua (iole.dicapua@szn.it)",     institution = "Stazione Zoologica Anton Dohrn",     license = "CC-BY-NC",     project = "DTO-BioFlow FSTP Grant",     processing_date = Sys.Date()   ),   file.path(output_dir, "metadata.csv") )

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: processed Darwin Core data ready integration EMODnet Biology following standards:

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # The data will be validated against WoRMS (World Register of Marine Species) # to obtain Life Sciences Identifiers (LSIDs) using the Taxon Match tool # This ensures taxonomic consistency with international databases  # Example WoRMS integration workflow: # 1. Submit genus_species names to WoRMS Taxon Match # 2. Retrieve LSIDs and taxonomic hierarchy # 3. Add scientificNameID column with WoRMS LSIDs # 4. Validate against accepted names and synonyms

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
code: # Measurements will be standardized using BODC NERC Vocabulary Server # to ensure consistent terminology for: # - Life stages (adult, juvenile, copepodite, etc.) # - Measurement units (individuals per cubic meter) # - Sampling instruments (WP2 net, Indian Ocean net) # - Sample preservation methods (ethanol, formaldehyde)  # This enables interoperability with other marine biodiversity datasets

title: LTER-MareChiara Data Processing Workflow
text: workflow transforms 40 years LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data FAIR-compliant, Darwin Core-formatted dataset suitable : EMODnet Biology publication quality control European Digital Twin Ocean integration International biodiversity databases compatibility Long-term ecological research climate change studies standardized dataset contributes EU Mission “Restore Ocean & Waters 2030” providing essential biodiversity monitoring data Mediterranean Sea ecosystem.

what: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
title: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
text: Gulf Naples - 40 Years Zooplankton Biodiversity Assessment ZooGoN standardizes taxonomic names Mediterranean zooplankton datasets spanning four decades (1984-2024) LTER-MareChiara station Gulf Naples. R package part DTO-BioFlow project (Digital Twin Ocean - Biodiversity Flow Integration) EU Horizon Mission “Restore Ocean & Waters 2030”.

title: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
text: package processes comprehensive long-term zooplankton dataset Western Mediterranean Sea, including: 📊 1,506 zooplankton samples (1984-2024) 🦐 148 copepod species + 61 taxa 🌍 Integration European Digital Twin Ocean

title: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
text: Taxonomic Standardization: Robust genus-species extraction complex taxonomic strings Species Complex Handling: Converts multi-species entries Family-level Processing: Creates standardized names family entries Darwin Core Compliance: Converts datasets international biodiversity standards FAIR Data Principles: Ensures Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable data EMODnet Biology Integration: Quality-controlled data publication workflow

title: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
text: can install development version ZooGoN GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("ioledc/ZOOGoN-40Y")

title: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
code: library(ZooGoN)  # Example taxonomic names from Gulf of Naples zooplankton samples taxa_examples <- c(   "Sardinella+Sardinops",                    # Species complex   "Clupeidae n.i.",                          # Family level     "Engraulis - group",                       # Higher group   "Lutjanus (Paradies) argentimaculatus (Forsskål, 1775)",  # Full binomial   "Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893"       # Standard binomial )  # Standardize taxonomic names standardized <- extract_genus_species(taxa_examples) print(standardized)  # Expected output: #   original_name                                          genus_species #   <chr>                                                  <chr>         # 1 Sardinella+Sardinops                                   Sardinella spp # 2 Clupeidae n.i.                                         Clupegenus sp # 3 Engraulis - group                                      Engraulis indet # 4 Lutjanus (Paradies) argentimaculatus (Forsskål, 1775) Lutjanus argentimaculatus # 5 Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893                     Chiridius poppei

title: ZooGoN • Gulf of Naples Zooplankton Biodiversity
text: package provides comprehensive function processes entire LTER-MareChiara dataset raw Excel files Darwin Core format: integrated workflow includes: - Taxonomic standardization using extract_genus_species() - WoRMS validation taxonomic accuracy (optional) - Darwin Core formatting Event, Occurrence, eMoF tables - Geographic metadata LTER-MareChiara station - Quality control data validation - CSV export capabilities
code: # Complete workflow in a single function call processed_data <- process_lter_data(   zoo_data_path = "data/lter_zoo_84_13.xlsx",   ids_data_path = "data/ids.xlsx",    worms_validation = TRUE,   output_format = "list",   verbose = TRUE )  # Access Darwin Core formatted results event_table <- processed_data$event occurrence_table <- processed_data$occurrence measurements <- processed_data$emof

what: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
title: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
text: function parses vector taxonomic names LTER-MareChiara zooplankton dataset attempts extract standardize genus-species level information Darwin Core compliance. handles various cases commonly found Mediterranean zooplankton taxonomy including species complexes, family-level entries, higher taxonomic groups, standard binomial names author citations.

title: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
code: extract_genus_species(taxa_vector)

title: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
text: taxa_vector character vector taxonomic names zooplankton samples. Typically TAXA column LTER-MareChiara dataset.

title: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
text: tibble two columns: original_name original taxonomic string provided. genus_species extracted standardized genus-species name suitable Darwin Core scientificName field.

title: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
text: standardization follows rules: Species complexes (e.g., "Genus1+Genus2") become "Genus1 spp" Family-level entries (e.g., "Familidae n..") become "Familgenus sp" Higher groups dashes (e.g., "Genus - group") become "Genus indet" Standard binomials authors cleaned "Genus species" format Subgenus information parentheses removed Unmatched entries retain original form

title: Extract standardized genus-species names from taxonomic strings — extract_genus_species
code: # Examples from Gulf of Naples zooplankton samples taxa_examples <- c(   "Sardinella+Sardinops",                    # Species complex   "Clupeidae n.i.",                          # Family level identification   "Engraulis - group",                       # Higher taxonomic group   "Lutjanus (Paradies) argentimaculatus (Forsskål, 1775)",  # With subgenus & author   "Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893",       # Standard binomial with author   "Larvae n.i."                              # Developmental stage entry )  result <- extract_genus_species(taxa_examples) print(result) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   original_name                                         genus_species            #>   <chr>                                                 <chr>                    #> 1 Sardinella+Sardinops                                  Sardinella spp           #> 2 Clupeidae n.i.                                        Clupegenus sp            #> 3 Engraulis - group                                     Engraulis indet          #> 4 Lutjanus (Paradies) argentimaculatus (Forsskål, 1775) Lutjanus argentimaculat… #> 5 Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893                     Chiridius poppei         #> 6 Larvae n.i.                                           Larvae n                  # Expected output: # original_name                                          genus_species # "Sardinella+Sardinops"                                 "Sardinella spp" # "Clupeidae n.i."                                       "Clupegenus sp" # "Engraulis - group"                                     "Engraulis indet" # "Lutjanus (Paradies) argentimaculatus (Forsskål, 1775)" "Lutjanus argentimaculatus" # "Chiridius poppei Giesbrecht, 1893"                    "Chiridius poppei" # "Larvae n.i."                                          "Larvae n.i."

what: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
title: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
text: function implements complete data processing workflow LTER-MareChiara zooplankton dataset, transforming raw Excel data Darwin Core-compliant format WoRMS taxonomic validation. function handles 40 years Gulf Naples zooplankton monitoring data (1984-2024) prepares EMODnet Biology publication Digital Twin Ocean integration.

title: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
code: process_lter_data(   zoo_data_path = "data/lter_zoo_84_13.xlsx",   ids_data_path = "data/ids.xlsx",   worms_validation = TRUE,   output_format = "list",   output_dir = "data/darwin_core",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
text: zoo_data_path Character string. Path main zooplankton data Excel file. Default "data/lter_zoo_84_13.xlsx". ids_data_path Character string. Path sample IDs Excel file. Default "data/ids.xlsx". worms_validation Logical. Whether perform WoRMS taxonomic validation. Default TRUE. Set FALSE skip WoRMS matching faster processing. output_format Character string. Output format processed data. Options "list" (default) list Darwin Core tables, "csv" write CSV files specified directory. output_dir Character string. Directory write CSV files output_format = "csv". Default "processed_data/darwin_core". verbose Logical. Whether print processing messages. Default TRUE.

title: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
text: list containing Darwin Core formatted tables: event Event extension table sampling event information occurrence Occurrence extension table species occurrence data emof Extended Measurement Fact (eMoF) table quantitative data raw_data Processed raw data Darwin Core conversion processing_info Metadata processing workflow

title: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
text: processing workflow includes: Loading restructuring raw abundance data Applying ZooGoN taxonomic standardization WoRMS taxonomic validation matching Darwin Core format conversion (Event, Occurrence, eMoF tables) Geographic coordinate assignment LTER-MareChiara station Quality control data validation Data Sources: function processes two main Excel files: Main zooplankton data: Species abundance matrix sampling dates columns Sample IDs: Mapping dates standardized sample identifiers Taxonomic Processing: Applies extract_genus_species() name standardization Splits genus-species names separate genus species columns Attempts WoRMS validation using worrms::wm_records_taxamatch() Handles taxonomic matching errors gracefully NA values Darwin Core Compliance: Event Extension: Sampling events temporal spatial information Occurrence Extension: Species occurrences presence/absence status eMoF Extension: Quantitative measurements (abundance ind/m³) Geographic Information: LTER-MareChiara station coordinates automatically assigned: Latitude: 40.81°N Longitude: 14.25°E Location: Gulf Naples, Tyrrhenian Sea, Mediterranean

title: Process LTER-MareChiara zooplankton data to Darwin Core format — process_lter_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic processing with WoRMS validation processed_data <- process_lter_data()  # Access individual Darwin Core tables events <- processed_data$event occurrences <- processed_data$occurrence measurements <- processed_data$emof  # Process without WoRMS validation for faster execution quick_data <- process_lter_data(worms_validation = FALSE)  # Export directly to CSV files process_lter_data(   output_format = "csv",   output_dir = "my_output_folder" )  # Process with custom file paths custom_data <- process_lter_data(   zoo_data_path = "custom/path/zooplankton.xlsx",   ids_data_path = "custom/path/sample_ids.xlsx" ) } # }
